abstract: A legal settlement giving Google online rights to out-of-print orphan books is being challenged in court.
snippet: A legal settlement giving Google online rights to out-of-print orphan books is being challenged in court.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  The dusty stacks of the nation’s great university and research libraries are full of orphans  books that the author and publisher have essentially abandoned. They are out of print, and while they remain under copyright, the rights holders are unknown or cannot be found.

headline.main: Google’s Plan for Out-of-Print Books Is Challenged
headline.print_headline: Some Raise Alarms as Google Resurrects Out-of-Print Books

abstract: Google must defend itself against claims that its sponsored links on search results violated the trademark rights of the Rescuecom Corporation, an appeals court said.
snippet: Google must defend itself against claims that its sponsored links on search results violated the trademark rights of the Rescuecom Corporation, an appeals court said.
lead_paragraph: Google must defend itself against claims that its sponsored links on search results violated the trademark rights of the Rescuecom Corporation, an appeals court said. Rescuecom, a computer services company, sued in 2004 over the use of its company name as a “keyword” in the AdWords program used by Google. Advertisers can buy placement on a search-results page based on the use of such keywords, and in some cases the “sponsored links” are shown at the top of the results.

headline.main: Trademark Lawsuit Over Google Ads Can Proceed
headline.print_headline: Trademark Lawsuit Over Google Ads Can Proceed

abstract: Opposition to aspects of the Google books settlement has been building slowly in academic circles and beyond.
snippet: Opposition to aspects of the Google books settlement has been building slowly in academic circles and beyond.
lead_paragraph: Updated 10 a.m. Added reference to Consumer Watchdog.

headline.main: It’s Not Just Microsoft Balking at Google’s Book Plans
